alert.note: Alert for Custer; Dewey; Ellis; Roger Mills (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:38AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Ellis, eastern Roger Mills, western Custer and southwestern Dewey Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 438 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northwest of Angora to 4 miles southeast of Cheyenne. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Hammon, Leedey, Butler, Camargo, Strong City, Moorewood, Foss Reservoir, and Angora. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
